content.raw: What is the `constexpr` doing here?

content.raw: We talked about this offline, and I’m convinced that this will work as expected.  My concern was that it may not actually be _constexpr_, but because all of the values are either `true_type` or `false_type` from template instantiations, it shouldn’t be an issue here.
content.html: We talked about this offline, and I’m convinced that this will work as expected. My concern was that it may not actually be constexpr, but because all of the values are either true_type or false_type from template instantiations, it shouldn’t be an issue here.

content.raw: Is it necessary to make these pure virtual? It's one more thing that downstream devs need to override, even if they're doing it just to keep it empty.
content.html: Is it necessary to make these pure virtual? It's one more thing that downstream devs need to override, even if they're doing it just to keep it empty.

content.raw: We can make it nonpure, but then there won't be any warning message printed if a user tries to serialize a component that doesn't implement these functions. I was under the impression that `BaseComponent` was an internal class that should not be subclassed by downstream users.
content.html: We can make it nonpure, but then there won't be any warning message printed if a user tries to serialize a component that doesn't implement these functions. I was under the impression that BaseComponent was an internal class that should not be subclassed by downstream users.

content.raw:
> there won't be any warning message printed if a user tries to serialize a component that doesn't implement these functions

The warnings being deleted in this PR wouldn't work?

> I was under the impression that BaseComponent was an internal class that should not be subclassed by downstream users.

Initially `Component` was meant to be a convenient wrapper, but we wanted to give developers the flexibility of using `BaseComponent` as they please. But ok, I'm fine leaving them as pure virtual, since the main use case will be through `Component` anyway.
content.html:
there won't be any warning message printed if a user tries to serialize a component that doesn't implement these functions

The warnings being deleted in this PR wouldn't work?

I was under the impression that BaseComponent was an internal class that should not be subclassed by downstream users.

Initially Component was meant to be a convenient wrapper, but we wanted to give developers the flexibility of using BaseComponent as they please. But ok, I'm fine leaving them as pure virtual, since the main use case will be through Component anyway.

content.raw: Ah, those warnings were using `this->TypeId()`. I was looking at the ones that were doing `typeid(DataType).name()` which we couldn't do in the base class. I'm changing it so they are not pure virtual.
content.html: Ah, those warnings were using this->TypeId(). I was looking at the ones that were doing typeid(DataType).name() which we couldn't do in the base class. I'm changing it so they are not pure virtual.
